data.title: Great service
data.text: We came to this restaurant for a 50 year old bd party for a gf.  We decided to get the 4 course meal for $45- each.  There was too much food, but it was delicious.  I would get 2 less courses and eat just as much. We had to leave some of the food because they gave way too much for the 4 of us.  It's a great place to celebrate something special.

data.title: Didn't live up to expectations
data.text:
This place is overpriced, smokes, and a lot of work.  You can find better fondue places, and if you do fondue at home, you'll get more for your money, without having to tip someone who didn't do much work.

Expect that the bill will exceed your expectations, while the food will be underwhelming.

data.title: Kids eat free with adult meal on Sunday
data.text: We are family of four and children love coming here to grill their own food.   Their meal combo is the best value.  On Sunday kids eat free with adult combo meal.  Service is iffy - depends on who you get.  It can be excellent to subpar.  Ingredients are fresh but marinated on the salty side.  The desserts dipped in chocolate is the main reason the children like it so much.  Takes a long time for the meal - about 1.5-2 hours and reservations is recommended.

data.title: The food was great.
data.text: I had the fondue for lunch, and it was delicious.  The service was also very good.  The only bad thing I can say is that there was a lot of stored, excess restaurant supplies in plain view. The ambiance could have been improved. I would definitely go back

data.title: Very expensive for what is essentially a self catering night out!
data.text: We went on a team work do so thank god I was not picking up the tab. The fondue course to be fair was very nice although the choice of items to dip in the cheese was very limited. I'm sorry but i just didn't get the main course. We were given a wide choice of things to select from a menu and then a small hotplate placed in front of us. It was too small and simply not hot enough to cook the plates of raw food that were delivered. I ordered some bit of steak and due to the low temperature of the grill they kinda cooked slowly away for a while but never sizzled or seared nicely. Basically you go there and cook your own food and they charge you a small fortune for the privilege. I just don't get it

data.title: Birthday Celebration
data.text: Went to Simply Fondue for about the 6th time and enjoyed ourselves as usual.  The food was as good as usual and it was nice to see a few changes to the menu items.  We had a really good time as a family enjoying our meal together.  We've always enjoyed coming here but we've had better service than this time.

data.title: Great place for fondue in the valley
data.text: Decided to meet up in Livermore as a centrally located spot for people from Modesto and San Jose and thought a fondue place would give us plenty of time to sit and catch up. Simply Fondue was a great choice! The food was fantastic and is served course by course over a period of about 2.5 hours. We could hardly wait for the phenomenal chocolate fondue at the end. It was well worth the wait. Loved that our server asked us during both the cheese and dessert portions of our meal if we would like any additional items to dip if we ran out of anything. One thing to note is that parking at the restaurant itself can be somewhat difficult to find but there is a free parking structure on Railroad, which is a quick walk away. Will definitely be back here!

data.title: Great Bar
data.text:
Simply Fondue is difficult to get a table. The bar provides a comfortable atmosphere with terrific martinis.  The chocolate martini is killer!!!
In my opinion, the price-line is overpriced for the product quantities received.  The establishment can be a romantic backdrop.

data.title: Birthday
data.text: Neat concept. Went for my birthday and had an awesome experience. My favorite part was the appetizers and the dessert menus. Dinner menu was just ok, nothing great there. We got in at 8 and left at 10:10 even thou they close at 10. Server was alittle rushed. Not very helpful in explaining things. But have a good time anyways :) oh one more thing, it's very expensive.

data.title: Great Mojitos
data.text: WE have gone to Simply Fondue for happy hour several times and eaten there a couple. Dinner can be expensive but happy hour is reasonable. Several small plates are available during happy hour. Huge selection of cocktail and mojitos, wines, very nice atmosphere with bar/ small tables and couch. if you have dinner try to save room for the Chocolate fondue desert.

data.title: Bar menu is the best!
data.text: We have been going to Simply Fondue since it first opened, but the last few years we started eating in the bar area instead of the main restaurant, and it has been so much fun!  We love the bar menu food, and only do the fondue for dessert, and of course a martini or two to go along with it all!  The bartenders or so nice, and really fun to watch them mixing up the martinis.

data.title: Good food, but pricey and sloooow service.
data.text:
Tried this place for my son's birthday. Ambiance was good enough, but we got seated at one of the tables in the inner room, and it felt like we were in a dungeon! Not enough lighting and air circulation, and with all the smoke from the other tables, I could barely see across our table.

The waitress really took her time in coming over and asking for our drinks...15 minutes later she came back to take our order, but no drinks. Drinks came after another 5 minutes. Then the wait started for the food...another 10 minutes before the pots were set up...We ordered the all you can eat, and it just took forever to put in the next orders to our waitress. Between the appetizers, the entrees and the dessert, we were there for 3 hours and 20 minutes! 

When we finally got out (of the dungeon), we all smelled like smoked salmon!

Not going back.

data.title: So good.......
data.text: First visit to Simply Fondue; went for lunch midweek, restaurant was not busy at this time. I Ordered a whiskey cheddar fondue and my friend ordered a swiss. The fondue is made right at your table. The whiskey cheddar fondue was delicious - really very good. It came with bread and an assortment of fresh vegetables. I would have liked more bread, which apparently you can get if you ask, but didn't know this until the fondue was gone.  So, I loved the food and hope to return.  I recommend the restaurant and suggest you request more bread if you want it.

data.title: Amazing dinner!!!
data.text: I would have given this restaurant 5 stars, had our server not been so boring and personalityless.  We came in a group of 5 and ordered lots of martinis and wine, fondue and the lobster trio! I've never had a meal where everyone said "oh my god" so many times. It was worth every penny, and I'd love to go again!

data.title: What an experience
data.text: A friend wanted to try this fondue restaurant as we we driving by so we flipped around and parked. So none of us had ever done the fondue thing. Now after coming here I bet we know have a high standard and many may not be able to keep up. Service was outstanding and food was impecable. They made this a real dining experience and not just a meal.We were impressed woth all aspects of this resturant.  Be prepared to spend some time here as it isn't just a here if your food. Watching the different cheeses come together in front of you was a cool thing to watch.

data.title: well made up  dolts -
data.text: If you like restaurants with young good looking women with a superiority complex, knowing they are so much better than people coming in to eat - this is your place - dark, cosy, romantic and forget really expensive for bread and cheese?

data.title: STAY FAR AWAY!!!
data.text:
If I could give this restaurant 0 stars I would! This 3.5 hour dinner was terrible from start to finish so bare with me as the list of complains is long. Last night we ate here with a group of friends to celebrate a birthday. (They really should not take reservations for large groups, as they can not properly accommodate them.) Our group of 9 were seated at 3 tables that had been joined together end to end. We were assigned 1 waitress. Right off the bat my husband, another couple and I asked if we could be on a separate check since the four of us were at one table sharing a burner. No problem there. The four of us decided to order the Fondue Feast and decided on a cheese and cooking style we could share. 

My friend and I had the California Caprese Salad. It is served "drizzled with italian dressing" which is strange, but whats worse is they were DROWNED in a terrible italian dressing! I wanted to send it back (which I very rarely do, but this was gross!), but the waitress did not come back to check on us through the entire salad course. I ended up scooping some of the dressing off and suffered through a little since I was starving.  

We were told we could order a second cheese if we wanted (It's included since we ordered 2 Fondue Feasts, but this was not clearly explained to us at the time). So we picked a second cheese. One of the cheeses arrives, and its a little while before we realize we only have one cheese. We ask our server who tells us our other cheese is on the burner 2 tables down (being eaten by the people sitting down there). So the four of us shared a appetizer and dippers meant for two and we unintentionally fed our friends seated at the other end of the table our other selection. I should mention that the rest of our group of friends ordered alla cart and we were not keeping track of what they were ordering so thought nothing of the cheese at the other end. 

Meanwhile, our dirty dishes are piling up and none of us have water. Our waitress appeared to have several other tables besides ours and we rarely saw her. Eventually I cleared some of our dirty dishes myself. 

Time for the main course. Our food arrived without any dipping sauces. We had to wait for our waitress to reappear to ask for some (there was lots of waiting for service). When she did appear, our friends 2 tables down asked for sauce. She came back with only enough for them, and left before our side of the table had the chancre to ask her to bring some for us too. The burner at our table was not heating the food properly. I wanted to ask someone to turn the grill up, but again, no one showed up. Once our friends finished cooking their food they had to cook ours for us too! I finally got up to complain to the manager and ask for a second waitress. The manager said she would see what she could do and another 10 mins go by before they reappear with a second waitress. By now I am so frustrated with the whole situation that I just want to skip desert, but we stay for the birthday girls sake.  

The waitress says we can order 2 chocolates with our Fondue Feast. When the chocolate arrives one is placed on our burner and one on the burner at the next table. A plate of desert dippers were set next to each. I notice that there are only 2 of each desert dippers (there are 4 of us), so I ask our server if we can have a second plate of dippers. She informs us that we already have another plate of dippers, it is on the other table (half eaten by the people sitting in front of it). I'm sure she saw the disbelief on my face, so she asked if I would like her to get it and bring it over. I told her that it was already half eaten and how awkward it would be to take it away from our friends at this point. I asked if she could please just bring one more plate since THEY messed up by putting it in front of our friends. She said no, that each chocolate comes with one plate and that we already got two. I continued explaining to her that we did NOT get two because they were not both placed on our table. It was like talking to a brick wall. I finally dropped it. 

At the end the manager announced that she removed the gratuity from our tab since we weren't happy. No apology for giving away 2 of our courses, or for our burner not heating properly, or for the terrible salad, for not receiving dipping sauce, and terrible service. I told the manager that just removing the gratuity was not enough. In the end, after reiterating all the problems (again!) she ended up giving us a discount off both checks but still no apology! I have never experienced such poor service from a restaurant. They served HALF of our food to our friends and then told us we were SOL! Unbelievable. It's the next day and I'm still dumbfounded by the whole experience. Do yourself a favor and go to a fancy steakhouse, same price for better quality food and service.

data.title: Date Night at Simply Fondue!
data.text: Really enjoyed our visit to Simply Fondue.  We kept it simple for our first time.  We just did the cheese and the meat sampler.  More than enough for my wife and I.  They have multiple broths to cook your meat in.  We chose the cajun which was very tasty and a good choice.  The choice of broth can be a big difference in the taste of your meal.  The cheese fondue was excellent.  Lots of flavour and worked well with the break and vegetables.  They also have different selections for cheese.  My wife was "coerced" into doing a dessert.  This was amazing.  One nice thing is if you bring in a bottle of wine from a local winery, there is no corkage fee.  We took advantage of this by bringing a nice bottle of Merlot from Wente.  Any fondue restaurant is expensive.  If you are a big eater and expect large portions of food, a fondue restaurant is perhaps not for you.  If you don't like doing your own cooking or are not very patient, then fondue is not for you.  Fondue restaurants are a very slow process but a lot of fun.  And Simply Fondue was a a very nice restaurant with great service and consistent pricing for a Fondue restaurant.

data.title: Good food
data.text: We ate here at lunch and enjoyed a nice meal, good food, quiet atmosphere, attentive but not overbearing service.  I plan to go again to try other dishes and to try dinner here sometime.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: We love us some fondue and this place does not disappoint. We will even go into the bar and have drinks and order a cheese fondue. It is plenty for dinner and is just enough. Dinner portions are huge.
